author: torben
title: CrypTrolls: A DAO Gaming Experience
description: With centrally organized gaming companies, the users(gamers) lack governance possibilities within their own games. It's time to change this!

author: mybrandt
title: OMIMIMO The Pure Water CNFTGame
description: We all need pure water so why not own a real world asset and NFT to help protect nature while gaining knowledge and having fun with the game

author: cryptoloops
title: Flooftopia: An Adorable CNFT Game!
description: Current NFTs and NFT games focus on rigid NFT structures and don't cater well to broad demographics.

author: ecomchaco
title: FulBit - NFT Football Game
description: There's a growing demand for sports-themed NFTs, yet the industry is lacking a good marketplace for them.

author: carnivilla
title: Onboarding Untapped Communities
description: Gamers in Metaverse-like communities lack functionality and ownership with their digital property and their environment's assets.

author: bmoore
title: ReWILD! : Bison Ranching in AR
description: Computer gaming can be a sedentary activity with potentially negative physiological and psychological consequences.

author: jmo
title: Cross-NFT Gaming: Shared Metaverse
description: There is no cohesive NFT metaverse. Most NFT games exist independent from each other, limiting their appeal to bring new users to Cardano.

author: mr.mietrich
title: Sandbox-MMO for language learning
description: Games are considered a waste of time/life. Most education systems are highly inappropriate, inaccessible, discriminatory or demotivating.

author: jmo
title: Money Management Game for Minors
description: Minors across the world lack skills and confidence to handle money responsibly.

author: dr.scurvey
title: Adalot the MMO/RPG/ECO-Sim
description:
Gamers want to play. And if they get rewarded while doing so, it is even better.
How do we implement ADA deeper into the Community?

author: toddchapin
title: Building the Realverse
description: Geo-Spatial Mapping Dapp Virtual Digital Twin of Globe needs to be developed to map the unmapped creating the where of the Cardano Ecosystem

author: guskollar
title: Metahagane - NFT Trading card game.
description: Game development is highly centralised with one team deciding every object, asset, character structure and storyline within their creation.

author: victorcorcino
title: Terra Cognita: AI+Blockchain Gaming
description: There is a lack of exciting, innovative games merging AI and Blockchain concepts in the Cardano ecosystem.

author: aljosa
title: OctoWars - a DCCG based world
description: Cardano doesn't have a high quality game which can be played indefinitely and can gain new users every day.

author: openlittermap
title: Gamifying Littercoin
description: Using OpenLitterMap is uneventful & missing a captivating gaming experience. We need a better gaming experience to achieve mass adoption

author: shirogat
title: Naisula and Aida
description: Culturally inclusive games that depict  the  not -so -well represented African cultures  are not available

author: grisemetamoonverse
title: Clash royale & starcraft mixed game
description: We plan on designing a game on cardano that is a mixture of starcaft and clash royale. With focus on it being Highly addictive.

author: mmahut
title: Cardano games assets for Unity
description: Unity, the game engine, lacks assets to interact with the Cardano blockchain.

author: angelferndz
title: Simple Play to Earn Game
description: Not enough play to earn games being developed on Cardano.

author: igor
title: Bears Club - Club Simulation Game
description: The crypto ecosystem lacks of games with social features, where people can play and socialize at the same time.

author: newmindflow
title: Trybbles Blockchain-Enabled AR Pets
description: Gaming will catapult Cardano to next levels of adoption, yet a large part of the gaming community is actively opposed to blockchain & NFTs.

author: silksteele
title: Fractional minting application
description: Game developers need NFT-based systems and tools that are audited, certified, and battle-tested.

author: bolt
title: Mechverse:Origin NFT based Game
description: Create a Game where the player owns all the pieces like a tabletop game

author: quest.zwerg
title: AdaQuest - Concept Phase 2
description: To ensure the future development of our long-term high fantasy classic RPG with competitive game modes, we will need additional funding.

author: mr.mietrich
title: Be a Tree! - The Tree Simulator!!
description: Common knowledge about trees and their needs, importance + uniqueness is rare. Millions of people cannot distinguish one tree from another.

author: heroindes
title: Play-to-Earn NFT Football game
description: There hasn't been a link between blockchain and the daily act of playing/practicing sports.

author: dcspark
title: Gaming dApp Hackathon
description: Many Ethereum developers do not know they can deploy their contract on Cardano through Milkomeda

author: lucasmac9
title: Defiants: Tales of the Ghostchain
description: People don't know where Cardano 's value comes from, the ecosystem within it, and its potential. As a result it´s story has been distorted.

author: jmo
title: Cross-NFT Gaming: NFT Fighters
description: Cross-NFT Gaming is a sleeping giant with huge untapped potential to attract un-chained gamers to Cardano

author: psmaxzaxster
title: Platform for painters
description:
A lot of painters in Slovenia, our country is famous and don t know how to do NFTs.
The same is in foreign countries, espesialy older ones.

author: jt.aussiegingersnap
title: No-Code NFT Generator [Revelar]
description: The process for creating generative NFT's is complex and hard for artists who want to create NFT's for games without an expensive developer.

author: jt.aussiegingersnap
title: Game Asset Analytics [Revelar]
description: Visualizing NFT movement and interactions through on chain explorers is confusing and complex.

author: jt.aussiegingersnap
title: Game Asset Management - [Revelar]
description: Managing multiple NFT projects (pre and post launch) is difficult and hard to track down assets for support.

author: jt.aussiegingersnap
title: Game Asset Image Embed [Revelar]
description: There doesn't exist an easy way to embed CNFT images + metadata on websites in a simple standard format.

author: jt.aussiegingersnap
title: Game Asset Minting Logic [Revelar]
description: While basic NFT minting API's exist, they don't account for minting on demand logic needed in games.

author: alex.pipo
title: IRONSKY PlaytoEarn Milestone of ADA
description: The Cardano ecosystem has few NFT games, not keeping up the Metaverse trend and will lose its competitiveness with other crypto ecosystems.

author: jt.aussiegingersnap
title: Game Token Design [Revelar + Duo]
description: Stable & successful NFT gaming rewards and token models are largely unknown and often only reward a few players.

author: jt.aussiegingersnap
title: NFT Game Assets API - [Revelar]
description: Game designers / developers need a simple and standard process for game asset generation prior to minting.

author: whazz
title: Social Mobile Game powered by CNFTs
description: Simple but important low hanging fruits use cases are underused to expose gamers to the ecosystem. Particularly mobile and social games.

author: ben.mesnik
title: NFT pools for game asset swaps
description: NFTs are very illiquid; to exchange virtual items quickly, such as trading cards, you'll likely lose money and time in the process.

author: skadea
title: Megaclite - Game Dev and Consulting
description: Due to blockchain being highly complex, it's hard for game developers to enter the ecosystem, since there is no clear road to guide them.

author: lineage.jon
title: Gliese 16c - Asian NFT game
description: Current crypto games are very Western centric. It is imperative to involve the East Asian's involvement in achieving wider adoption.

author: edwint
title: World of Pirates
description: Gamers want to be involved in every aspect of the game they love to play, to have impact in society and to control their in-game assets. [1]

author: ralphcnft
title: A Moon Based Metaverse on Cardano
description: Space tourism is a luxury reserved for the richest 0.1% of society and there isn't a way for everyone else to experience it right now

author: brianlee
title: Connecting Tabletop Games & Cardano
description: Tabletop gaming and the physical collectible market is a prime target for integration with Cardano. This is an untapped market for Cardano.

author: daniel.friedman
title: Plug-n-Play NFT/GameFi Toolkit
description: There is no easy, economical and effective way to create NFT-based play-to-earn/GameFi content and games on Cardano without coding.

author: pborm
title: Firestrike Soccer Game Migration
description: Sales platforms charge up to 30% commission which stifle profits and growth for small indie studios

author: card.afterdark
title: Cardano After Dark - Hold'em poker
description: 100+ million poker players are playing on centralised Poker-platforms which are holding their money and are charging high fees

author: rcmorano
title: Gamify LacedWhales Twitter bot
description: Driving ADAption through Twitter beyond talking price is not usually done and it can be a great viral, amplifier.

author: adosiawolf
title: market jetchicken NFT card game
description: jetchicken is a aligning for play-to-earn with the appeal to attract new users to Cardano, but creating broader brand awareness is costly

author: belaykkidus
title: DeFantasy- Daily Fantasy Football g
description: Creating a virtual game based on the world's favorite spot.Specifically targeting the African market.

author: ihdeveloper
title: Virtual Portal: Decentralized Place
description: Games relay on centralized service to establish a virtual environment to communicate and hang on. Why not establish it using Cardano?
